title: Breaking down the Deshaun Watson trade rumors and how we got to this point with the Texans (Football 1/12)
description:
Will Brinson is joined by Jonathan Jones to discuss the swirl of rumors that surround the NFL every January. This year, there's big buzz about a star quarterback that is reportedly unhappy in his current situation. Deshaun Watson has not been fond of several decisions the Texans have made and we're learning more about the extent of his unhappiness (5:05). But what will that displeasure result in? It's unlikely that Watson will be moved, but the thought at least has to be entertained at this point. JJ details some of the inner workings of the Houston organization and their leadership. The guys also take a look at the other GM and head coach vacancies around the league and how we expect those situations to develop (26:00). 
*Note: This episode was recorded prior to the Eagles firing Doug Pederson. For a full reaction to that move, check out the emergency podcast in the feed now!

'Pick Six' is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Stitcher, Google Podcasts, Castbox and wherever else you listen to podcasts. 
You can listen to Pick Six on your smart speakers! Simply say "Alexa, play the latest episode of the Pick Six NFL podcast" or "Hey Google, play the latest episode of the Pick Six NFL podcast."
Follow the Pick Six team on Twitter: @picksixpod, @willbrinson, @ryanwilsonCBS, @johnbreech, @E_DeBerardinis
Visit the Pick Six YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/picksix

content:encoded:
Will Brinson is joined by Jonathan Jones to discuss the swirl of rumors that surround the NFL every January. This year, there's big buzz about a star quarterback that is reportedly unhappy in his current situation. Deshaun Watson has not been fond of several decisions the Texans have made and we're learning more about the extent of his unhappiness (5:05). But what will that displeasure result in? It's unlikely that Watson will be moved, but the thought at least has to be entertained at this point. JJ details some of the inner workings of the Houston organization and their leadership. The guys also take a look at the other GM and head coach vacancies around the league and how we expect those situations to develop (26:00). 

*Note: This episode was recorded prior to the Eagles firing Doug Pederson. For a full reaction to that move, check out the emergency podcast in the feed now!
